bug.author: RaffaeleMarino
bug.summary: Model()[1].Paremeters() does not work in fnn

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sreenikSS>@sreenikSS</denchmark-link> , check this out, I guess <denchmark-link:https://github.com/RaffaeleMarino>@RaffaeleMarino</denchmark-link> , undergoes with the same issue over which we had the discussion. I am pretty sure now that it isn't there.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jeffin143>@jeffin143</denchmark-link> you are right. This needs to be promptly addressed.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/RaffaeleMarino>@RaffaeleMarino</denchmark-link> Thanks for the report, looks like the network isn't accessible via the mentioned Model() function. For a quick solution you could add: const std::vector<LayerTypes<CustomLayers...> >& Model() const { return network; } to the FFN class or if you don't like to rebuild mlpack: #define private public
model.network.[1].Parameters() could work as well; note this is not a safe solution. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jeffin143>@jeffin143</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sreenikSS>@sreenikSS</denchmark-link> do you have something else in mind?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zoq>@zoq</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jeffin143>@jeffin143</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sreenikSS>@sreenikSS</denchmark-link> Thank you very much for your advice and your time. I will see if I can rebuild mlpack, in the meantime I will check if the solution #define private public model.network.[1].Parameters() works. Raffaele
